intro: Hieraciodes pulchra, commonly known as the showy sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, aiding in water retention. Hieraciodes pulchra thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as coastal dunes and mountain slopes.
